data.title: Seychellois Creole
data.meta_description: Learn some Seychellois Creole for free
data.text:
Learn some Seychellois Creole

Seychellois Creole (Kreol seselwa) is one of the official languages spoken in the Seychelles by around 80,000 people.

Seychellois Creole is a French based Creole. More than 98% of its vocabulary can be traced back to the French language of the 17th and 18th century, via the French settlers who arrived in the Seychelles from Mauritius and RÃ©union.

The Lords Prayer in Seychellois

Ou, nou papa ki dan lesyel,

Fer ou ganny rekonnet konman Bondye.

Ki ou renny i arive.

Ki ou lavolonte i ganny realize

Lo later parey i ete dan lesyel

Donn nou sak zour nou dipen ki nou bezwen.

Pardonn nou pour bann lofans

Ki noun fer anver ou,

Parey nou pardonn sa ki n ofans nou.

Pa les tantasyon domin nou,

Me tir nou dan lemal.
